metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8791 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The EbmlElement::ReadCodedSizeValue function in libEBML before 1.3.3 allowscontext-dependent attackers to obtain sensitive information from processheap memory via a crafted length value in an EBML id, which triggers aninvalid memory access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8791` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libebml4 - 1.3.0-2+deb8u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libebml package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-2+deb8u1build0.14.04.1').
